result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph M Baier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 2/12/2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept. Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 18 days served; Huber privileges with release to the Day Report Center. Court recommends against electronic monitoring.

Court does not suspend driving privileges.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph M Baier

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph M Baier in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Joseph M Baier in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.
Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 18 days served; Huber privileges with release to the Day Report Center. Court recommends against electronic monitoring.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 2/12/2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept. Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Court does not suspend driving privileges.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.    Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Defendant Joseph M Baier in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Joseph M Baier in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.

  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 6  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Defense attorney requests a Return on Warrant date. Per request, case is set for Return on Warrant on 5/4/2015 at 10:00am. ADA's notified.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Discharge Summary report, received and filed.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Non-Compliance report, received and filed. lms
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Joseph M Baier not in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.      Deputy court clerk: LMS.

NO FILE IN COURT.  Matter in court for non-compliance.  Case was staffed.  Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and WITHHOLDS entry of judgment of conviction into the record.

Deferred Prosecution Agreement received and filed.  Court orders case adjourned for review hearing.  Case adjourned for review hearing before Judge Brostrom  , Branch 06, per Chief Judge Directive.
.
Case adjourned to March 10, 2015 at 8:30 a.m. for Review.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
Defendant have No Contact with any Firearms or cannot apply for a Carry Conceal Permit.

Defendant Joseph M Baier in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Jeffrey James Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy clerk:  dn
.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brostrom, Br. 6.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

At the request of the parties, case is calendared for a deferred prosecution agreement on 01/16/2015 at 01:15 p.m. in Room 509 of the Courthouse.
